website_summaries.verdict: Considering the Onkyo TX-NR646's generous feature set and superlative sonic skills, it's one heck of a value.
pros: The fully-loaded Onkyo TX-NR646 delivers cutting-edge technologies such as both Dolby Atmos and DTS-X surround formats, in addition to AirPlay, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth
Its sound quality is excellent for movie replay with exciting sonics and class-leading dynamics
Its superb connectivity includes eight HDMI inputs (one front, seven rear) and two outputs in addition to a phono input
cons: The Onkyo TX-NR646's Dolby Atmos height channel capabilities are limited to only the front-left and -right channels, not the surround height channels, and the receiver is only DTS:X "compatible" until an update is released later in 2015
Its external design is generic and bulky, and the user experience isn't helped by its terrible remote and an ancient menu system

customer_reviews.title: failed after less than 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I previously reviewed this and lamented that it was already obsolete when I bought it (not enough channels, no support for Dolby Vision). Now, less than 3 years old and I'm getting frequent "check speaker" shutdowns. I paid to have everything rewired but the problem persists. I should have checked Google. Other users report the same issue with NO SPEAKERS ATTACHED. I'm dumping it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: I have had this model for literally 2 weeks when ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this model for literally 2 weeks when the HDMI output stopped sending anything to my TV. I did some googling and found that this is a common problem with a range of Onkyo Receiver models and the fix is to pay shipping (~$50) to send it to an authorized dealer. I'm not even going to try that as I have no way of trusting that this won't happen again in 2 weeks. I did not heed the 1 star reviews when initially buying this product. Do not make the same mistake I made. I'm never buying Onkyo again.
customer_reviews.author: Jayson

customer_reviews.title: Lip Sync, Popping, and Bluetooth Issues
customer_reviews.text: I'm having a ridiculous amount of issues with the lip sync between the TV and receiver. Also, a strange speaker pop whenever it changes between options. And a hiss when there is silence during a show. It's not the TV as my old Only that friend out after 12yrs had no issues. It's not the HDMI cables as I have replaced every one now. There is no lip sync setting on the receiver. Also, the Bluetooth takes forever to connect, which was one of the main reasons I bought this. When it is working, it sounds great. As expected. But good damn it's a Terrible piece of AV equipment to wrangle into functioning.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Dowie

customer_reviews.title: caught fire after short use
customer_reviews.text: Hardly used this receiver, Decided to play the radio over bluetooth and realized I was disconnected. I went to look at it and saw the power was off so I used the remote to power the unit on. It blazed fire and I quickly unplugged the unit. Onkyo state that it is pass the warranty deadline by a month and would not help resolve the issue. I reached out back to amazon and amazon took care of the issue.
customer_reviews.author: nadenebarker

customer_reviews.title: NG fault codea
customer_reviews.text: This machine finally stopped working a little over a year since I purchased it. During that time it quit on me several times, causing lengthy inerruptuions, I initially thought it was due to heavy usage, turns out to be a design flaw. Do not purchase this model, in the future I'll try Yamaha again.
customer_reviews.author: rdj

customer_reviews.title: Too bad customer service isn't a priority at Onkyo.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product and its features. And it worked great for several months until it didn't which happens sometimes with complicated electronics. That is why there is a manufacturers warranty. But working with Onkyo's customer service has been disappointing. Only one sentence emails in reply. Then told to contact the service center, a third party TV repair shop across the country, and Onkyo says they won't pay shipping. I've been spoiled by so many other modern companies with excellent customer service who can organize and schedule their own repairs and can provide a shipping label and a UPS pick up to return the item. It is a shame Onkyo is stuck in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working just over two years after purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have now owned two Onkyo receivers in a row. The previous one quit putting sound out of one port after several years (I think 4). Thinking this must be a fluke, I bought a new one. My current one just started doing the same thing just over two years after purchase, and unfortunately the warrantee is only two years. I can’t believe these receivers are still being prominently displayed and promoted on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: David A Terry

customer_reviews.title: Hiss at High Volumes on HDMI Inputs
customer_reviews.text: The 3 Onkyo Recievers I tried TX-NR646, TX-NR787, RZ-830 all hiss at higher volumes on their HDMI inputs. You don't even need a source connected. The Integra DRX 3.2 does not share this design flaw. Also Onkyo tech support used to be good, but my experience across 5 calls with different agents is now terrible. Promises to escalate and call me back were 3 times ignored. I would not buy another Onkyo receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Brad W.

customer_reviews.title: Works great. More than adequate.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. More than adequate. I had to buy new receiver to accommodate my new 4K TV. I used to buy high end receivers paying thousands of dollars in the past. But the rapid development in technology forces you now to upgrade your receiver every few years to keep up. So, I opted to buy this Onkyo at .very good price given it was last year model. This year model has no major upgrade. It can handle 4K, and 3D TV's. Has wifi connection, and more than you need HDMI connections, only 3 of them however are hdcp 2.2
customer_reviews.author: Talal Zraik

customer_reviews.title: Will break do not buy, you will waste time and money.
customer_reviews.text: Had for 2 days. Wired the onkyo perfectly as the instructions stated. At first speaker would pop, then i got an error code. 2 Days!!! I thought this would be the best bang for the buck. On paper it is. But listen the reviews. This thing is far from reliable. Went back to old sony and guess what, works perfect. I will never own or recommend another onkyo. Looks pretty, but ugly when the amp diag mode code come on.
customer_reviews.author: Zak

customer_reviews.title: I love this reciever
customer_reviews.text: I love this reciever. I have had multiple theatre systems and this one deffinatly preforms. It is incredibly versatile with how you want to set your system up. It gives you a layout of how you want to align your speakers and will tell you what works best for your room. I love the pop up menu on the tv for easy"ish" navigation. Little complicated to get to everything, but after a couple of times, its not so bad. It sounds super clean (i have a 7.1 onkyo speaker setup) and it makes the room feel 10x bigger. Coupled with a decent projector, a comfy couch, and you set up a nice theater for little money and effort.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and easy installation
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a previous Onkyo receiver that quit working. I stayed with the brand because of its overall rating and friend recommendations . The new receiver is installed and working terrific . The reason I have a home theater system is because I enjoy two zones . I love playing the stereo on my back patio or when swimming in the pool . So I'm not really an expert on the home theater aspects of the situation . But to my ears it really produces high-quality sound . Girl Power!!!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this! Complicated!
customer_reviews.text: This system sounds great but it is very difficult to operate. It is not user friendly. The Bluetooth does not work well. It worked on my old phone and would not connect to my new phone. The sound is great. We bought it in March 2016 and today it started sparking and smoke came out. It was scary!!! I do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: ROGUE

customer_reviews.title: you'll like it. A bit intimidating at first
customer_reviews.text: DEFINITELY needs a learning curve, but once you realize what all the settings are, you'll like it. A bit intimidating at first, but just keep trying different settings and I'M SURE you'll find the one that is right for YOU - after all, what you HEAR is what YOU like, NOT what some factory has pre-set FOR YOU. EACH individual has different responses to a setting, so THIS gives you the opportunity to find WHAT IS RIGHT FOR YOU !
customer_reviews.author: Ellis B. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great home theater receiver with tons of features
customer_reviews.text: Excellent home theater receiver. I bought this to replace an Onkyo receiver that I've enjoyed for years but wanted to start investing in 4K/UHD gear in anticipation of it becoming more widely available. Easy to set up and use especially if you have a tablet or smartphone to use the Onkyo app to replace the provided remote. The receiver's software can be updated to help make this a future-proof as possible, Bonuses for me were the ability to connect my turntable which the previous one could not and Bluetooth for playing music off my other devices.
customer_reviews.author: D. Corbishley

customer_reviews.title: Bad HDMI ports
customer_reviews.text: Stay away from this. Worked awesome for the first 3 months. the first HDMI port went bad I thought I set something wrong so I just moved device to new port. Then after another year the second HDMI port went bad. I did read some of the reviews talking about this before I bought it. However I assumed they did something wrong. I guess I was wrong! There is definitely something wrong with the parts they are using. They had a big issue in other models as well. Guess they never fixed the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Rita G.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for us.
customer_reviews.text: So far this works perfectly. We have it set up for 5.1 surround sound in the family room as zone A, and then we have 2 speakers outside for zone B. Many of the receivers did not have this option. We also have all of our accessories (cable box, playstation) routed through the receiver, so we don't need to toggle the inputs on both the TV and receiver, which saves us a step.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY ONKYO!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in December of 15 for 700.00. July of 19 found me with a 20 lb onkyo door stop due to a defective HDMI card. Tech advised Onkyo outsourced their HDMI cards to a chinese crap company and HDMI cards are dropping like flies. This is crap. Card and labor exceed value. KMA Onkyo!!! File note: My son still has the Pioneer rack system I bought in 1986. Still working like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Don S

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Amp quality kinda blew me away coming from a very expensive 15 year old Denon receiver. HDMI handshake with 4K 4.4.4.4 works perfectly (I did update it immediately after plugging it in for the first time! Hello DTS X!) Menu's look dated, but have been 100% functional, wireless hooked up without any issues (dont think it supports 5GHz) and Onkyo's app is no frills and also works perfectly. Bottom line: Awesome sound quality, Works perfectly as a HDMI 4k/60p 4.4.4.4 switcher. Very reliable so far!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Urena

customer_reviews.title: Poor manufacturing and design resulting in no video or sound
customer_reviews.text: The Onkyo AV receivers have a long history of failure due to poor design and manufacturing. This is across a wide number of their various models. DSP chips and capacitors fail in a short amount of time due to heat problems. Search the internet, including YouTube to see a large amount of content dedicated to fixing these problems. I am amazed that a class action has not been taken against the company given the large number of people complaining online. Absolutely would not take a free Onkyo, let alone pay for another one. The authorized repair facility wants more to repair the unit than it costs new.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew W Watson

customer_reviews.title: After two weeks of excellent operation (except logging in to my PC over WIFI) ...
customer_reviews.text: After two weeks of excellent operation (except logging in to my PC over WIFI) the HDMI board went out and I have to sent it back for service
customer_reviews.author: tbob

customer_reviews.title: Great Receiver!
customer_reviews.text: Works great with Apple Music & airplay, along with other internet radio stations. Setup is much easier than the older Onkyo models and firmware update via the wi-fi network was fast and easy. Have a full surround sound system with Infinity Primus P163 bookshelf speakers, sub-woofer, center channel etc. The menu GUI could be sexier, but it's easy to navigate and works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Great Dad

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this product to anyone looking for a a mid ...
customer_reviews.text: After much trouble and not knowing how to set it up, world wide stereo called me immediately made sure I had my settings right and called a day later to make sure it was still working. Outstanding job guys! Everything is working as advertised. I recommend this product to anyone looking for a a mid level surround. World Wide Stereo are true professionals!
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Garbage! Many problems. Doesn't work after 3 yrs.
customer_reviews.text: This reciever has always taken way too long to initialize, constantly buffers when using the net feature even though has ethernet cord plugged directly in(none of my other devices have a problem) and now just shy of three years the hdmi outputs no longer work. Only sound plays but no pictures. Have done hard reset after hard reset. Currently shopping for different brand because mine is now useless unless you want to only listen to movie or tv
customer_reviews.author: tjgindy

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but has problems
customer_reviews.text: Unit has great sound, but the sound cuts out when changing channels with the TV for up to 10 seconds, kind of a pain in the Butt. I would not buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Under-powered. Very disappointed in the performance of this unit. Replaced an old Sony that died on me. This unit has all the hookups I required and to be honest had a decent price. Got it all hooked up to my Bose speaker system, fired it up and my heart sank. This unit seemed to have in my estimation half the power that my old 1993 model had. Would never buy this again and wouldn't recommend it to someone I liked.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy M Randell

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: Huge upgrade over older Yamaha receiver. Dolby Atmos audio is almost a religious experience compared to older pro logic surround sound. So many inputs and I have only seen the tip of the iceberg of Internet radio. There are so many channels to discover yet. Remote is kind of goofy and the manual is less than helpful but overall a great receiver for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzo

customer_reviews.title: Broke shortly after warranty went out
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two of these receivers now. In both cases, within a couple months of the warranty expiring the unit's audio completely stopped working. Like clockwork. The first time I attributed it to too much heat, so I bought some extra fans to vent out the warm air of the second unit. And here I am, two years later with another dead unit conveniently after the warranty expired. When it did work, it was fine. Worked how I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Lafontaine

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound; Confusing Controls
customer_reviews.text: So far, this seems to be a great receiver. The sound quality is far superior to my previous receiver, which was, itself, very highly rated and only about six years old. My only complaint is that the controls for the "A" and "B" speaker systems are really hard to understand and master.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Adams

customer_reviews.title: Like the functionality of this one better than the Yamaha
customer_reviews.text: Like the functionality of this one better than the Yamaha. It was easier to use. The first one we received did not work properly, so returned it. This one is acting up a bit. It will not keep standby mode on. I have to check to see if some of the settings were changed by other family members.
customer_reviews.author: Gennbarbie

customer_reviews.title: ... receiver for my temporary home location and it works great in an apartment environment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this receiver for my temporary home location and it works great in an apartment environment. I have a surround sound system, Bluray, HD TV, and cable system connected to it. This receiver performs well with everything I have in my system. I highly recommend it based on it's price and performance value. Supposedly DTS:X will be released for it in August, so that will make it even more desirable for some.
customer_reviews.author: Reginald M.

customer_reviews.title: What a great surround sound
customer_reviews.text: What a great surround sound. I have had an earlier model Onkyo for the past 12 years. This unit is superior in every way. I played one of my favorite movies after installing _ Pearl Harbor. If I could simply have closed my eyes and imagined there is no doubt I would have been in the center of the attack. Bullets were shooting by my head and sounds were fantastic. Don't ever believe that a "sound board" can come close to true surround sound and for this and for the price it can't be beat. I wish I could say more.
customer_reviews.author: peddler389

customer_reviews.title: Fail
customer_reviews.text: Was very good for about 2 years. Started getting Speaker errors every now and then. And then failed for good at just over 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: doin good

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for 2+ years, when it broke Onkyo told me I'm out of warranty and that was that. Called several repair shops and no one would even look at it.
customer_reviews.author: Mihow

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver with an odd issues
customer_reviews.text: Receiver sounds great though I seem to be having audio drop outs when skipping through the DVR. The audio codec ID lost and so far there only way to recover is to switch from TV source to another and then back to TV. Swapping cables dies not seen to fix the problem. I still question whether the problem is with the stb or the receiver. When working the receiver is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Seth V.

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about the number of hdmi inputs, 2 woofer outputs, Bluetooth connectivity and Atmos. I loved it at first, but the sounds keeps cutting out when we stream on our Roku. Works fine if we run the roku through the tv and optical cord to the receiver... but that’s not why I bought a receiver. I had some issues with my last Onkyo, but after this experience I’m done with them.
customer_reviews.author: JMick

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty and nice unit, but felt like this receivers confusing menu interface was dated from early 2000's, it was extremely difficult to use (and I'm very tech savvy) I purchased this unit because I needed the dual HDMI outputs for projector and TV. I got it it work well, but it took way too long, instructions really didn't help much. The remote is like a rubix cube trying to just switch inputs was so difficult, then switching outputs was another astronaut job! I hated this, and felt the Onkyo was so primitive. It did provide good power for my Monoprice speakers, the bass was outstanding. Sounded superb.
customer_reviews.author: Jason T

customer_reviews.title: Pleased as usual
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great!!! This is my 5th Onkyo receiver and am well pleased with it. As soon as 4K Blu-ray movies start coming out with Atmos I'll probably buy some Atmos speakers. The only thing I noticed when setting it up. It showed 7.1 when I use 2 subwoofers, (7.2) both work fine though. Atmos sounds amazing in the Movie Theaters! I saw Inferno the other day and the sound was amazing.
customer_reviews.author: RSN

customer_reviews.title: Great sound/iffy quality
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this for over a year now, and it has great sound and features! However, the HDMI inputs are not very good. The GAME input is unusable because it cuts out a lot. Just discovered that a few weeks ago. There have been rare instances of other inputs cutting out, but not enough to cause a fuss about. I just wish I could say it was perfect in every way, because the sound is great!
customer_reviews.author: MMaze

customer_reviews.title: Went for the best deal
customer_reviews.text: Great price on Amazon and it does include Latest technology but the reviews are correct about the weak graphics and the unreadable remote. Onkyo phone app helps greatly and the zone 2 is awewesome, able to listen to separate components. Bottom line is you great sound especially with the Dolby Atmos speakers and the 7.2. Great value now probably because it's last years model.
customer_reviews.author: Jwho?

customer_reviews.title: It has very good channel separation
customer_reviews.text: This has plenty of power for my HT set up. Gets really loud and clear. Cant hear any distortion at high volume. It has very good channel separation. Thes on screen menu is a nice feature. The only complaint is it wont connect with wifi. Its fine really since my router is only a few feet away from it and Id rather have as much as my components hard wired as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Superior sound
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Receiver to upgrade and replace a 9 year old Pioneer model. I must say the Onkyo is exceptional. Excellent sound quality and loads of features that were not on my Pioneer. Extremely pleased with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Not bad and not good either
customer_reviews.text: The phone stage had a hum noise and can't clear at low volume, that without any input. the internet is hard to used. power is good for high eff. speaker. 4K output fine but need to turn off the deep color, the USB input can't read all the video and audio file. This OK for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Phil C

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended product
customer_reviews.text: This receiver replaced a Dennon receiver I had only had for 3 years which had an HDMI port to go bad. I have only had the Onkyo in service for a few days but I am very impressed. It is more feature rich and generates far less heat than the Dennon. I pray it lasts more than 3 years. This unit does have a 2 year warranty. This product was recommended to me by the company that originally installed my sound system.
customer_reviews.author: Babsie

customer_reviews.title: I Love my Onkyo TX-NR646!!
customer_reviews.text: A Network receiver is the best thing that's happen to music since stereo!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph E. Elter

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Excellent entry equipment to the home theater, many functions, excellent sound at a very reasonable price, it handles excellent with your smartphone whether they are streaming music or the onkyo App itself. I use it mainly with Spotify, Netflix and prime video. On the other hand I will say it has no support for Tidal, and it does not scale to 4k but otherwise a great HTC for a small to medium sized room
customer_reviews.author: kaysyscom

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to set up.
customer_reviews.text: I have read the manual front and back and I can not for the life of me get it to work with my Samsung TV. It shows that it is connected but there is no sound, (no it's not on mute). I've done the initial "smart" set up and it still will not give me sound.
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver for the home theater set-up I have
customer_reviews.text: Great receiver for the home theater set-up I have. It automatically delivers whatever broadcast sound is being delivered. I particularly like that Zone 2 can be tuned to a separate function which allows you to watch TV in one room and listen to music in another.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Young

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy the NR636 a piece of expensive junk ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy the NR636 a piece of expensive junk the HDMI board gets way to hot and will burn out in less than three months and that's new not used. This one is more powerful, set up much much easier, bought this one new at half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E Bolton

customer_reviews.title: Other than that it sounds awesome!
customer_reviews.text: It has its quirks. When ever I have it on Blu-ray and I fast forward or skip tracks the audio cuts out from the receiver, I have to switch the input on the receiver to something else and then back to Blu-ray for the audio to come back on. I have tried 3 different Blu-ray players and the problem keeps happening. Other than that it sounds awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Troy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Came on time great packaging, upgraded the TV to 4K and had ...
customer_reviews.text: Came on time great packaging, upgraded the TV to 4K and had to do the receiver as well Easy to set up and works great
customer_reviews.author: Joe Valenta

customer_reviews.title: Everything I Expected and more.
customer_reviews.text: This product is everything I hoped it would be. Sound quality is great. I have it hooked up to Polk Audio speakers in my family room along with a 55" LG 4K Smart TV. Also have zone to pumping out sound to my back patio. Here too I have another set of Polk Audio speakers. I love being able to listen to what I want on the patio while my wife is watching TV.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Clem

customer_reviews.title: If you don't have to own the best, that most likely will not be fully used ...
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have to own the best, that most likely will not be fully used anyway, this receiver is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Audio and Video glitches
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these units and the audio and video keep switching off while viewing. It is soooo annoying. If anyone has any suggestions please let me know. Both of our units have audio issues. We can't use surround sound when viewing our smart TV. So strange to me.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Works and sounds great. Just using for music. Not video. Only complaint would be is it doesn't remember dlna setting after I turn it off and takes a little while to reconnect. Was very easy to set up. This is the fourth onkyo I've had.
customer_reviews.author: JES

customer_reviews.title: but once everything was connected and working I was very happy with the results
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a 10 year old Onkyo receiver. Admittedly it was a pain to set up with older and newer equipment, but once everything was connected and working I was very happy with the results. Phonograph connection was a plus. Bluetooth works trouble free.
customer_reviews.author: Art007

customer_reviews.title: Good receiver, simple connection process cables
customer_reviews.text: Good receiver , simple connection process cables, easy handling, a bit simple application , excellent interaction with zone 2, a bit complicated lap top internet connection and a defect is , that does not have side air vents as yamaha receivers. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: JAVIER REY

customer_reviews.title: ARC feature did not work
customer_reviews.text: The Onkyo TX-nr646 did not pass audio from the tv using the ARC feature, even after repeatedly going through updating software in both the tv and Onkyo. The ARC set up procedure was done more than one time without success.
customer_reviews.author: Island Kid

customer_reviews.title: 2 HDMI out- perfect. :-)
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite purchase on amazon. Love my Receiver with all new functions including airplay and Bluetooth streaming. Also love its apps t stream music online. Works very well on wifi and ethernet.One of the best features of this receiver is, it has 2 HDMI out. That's what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Auroraj

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Good choice for Home Theater.
customer_reviews.text: Fair price, great delivery and perfect product. Receiver has all the features for the amateur and the audiophile. Only concern is the remote needs to have illumination. Setup was easy, speaker connections allow for hard wire or banana plugs. Note, not RCA jacks. Wifi was simple. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Previously owned the Onkyo RT591 which produced great sound, I purchased this uit primarily for the ...
customer_reviews.text: Impressive features and extremely clear sound. Previously owned the Onkyo RT591 which produced great sound, I purchased this uit primarily for the abundance of features. So I was pleasantly surprised that is sound better than the rt591. I
customer_reviews.author: lunker

customer_reviews.title: Great 2 zone amplifier/tuner
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! I needed a two zone amplifier/tuner with a shallower depth for my cabinet- this definitely fit the bill! I used this to power my downstairs ceiling speakers, and used the zone 2 function to power my Niles 6 speaker selector for my outdoor and upstairs speakers. Definitely read the set-up guide to make sure the correct speakers are powered, but once the set-up is done it works wonderfully!
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Died in less than 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: Died in less than 2 years. No warranty to apply.
customer_reviews.author: Prefer wired to wireless

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME RECEIVER
customer_reviews.text: Did my homework before making this purchase, I was going to purchase the TX-NR656 but after reviewing the specs, there wasn't much of a difference so I went with the TX-NR646 instead. I'm able to use Airplay, Bluetooth and all my blu-ray movies sound unbelievable with this receiver. Very impressed and would definitely recommend. This receiver makes you want to rewatch all your blu-ray movies...
customer_reviews.author: William Rivera

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing. Especially the second zone feature which allowed me ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. Especially the second zone feature which allowed me to have sound on my patio.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good receiver, excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, though a little complicated to figure out all the inputs and outputs. No tape loop, which is a drag though.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I love it. Technology has chamged a lot since I ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Technology has chamged a lot since I purchased my last stereos. Now they are complicated but sound great once you install it and learn how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalo Bures

customer_reviews.title: this is a great receiver for the price
customer_reviews.text: this is a great receiver for the price. been buying onkyo for over 20 years. never had a problem. wanted to update to a 4K receiver because of new tv. hook up was easy. picture quality thru the receiver looks great. didn't realize it had no 110v outlets to plug other components into, other than that I would recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Works great, Thaàak u
customer_reviews.text: Works great, Thaàak u... I really need to continue to understand how certain things work and why, that is some hdmi ports, not so easy to use or do what they say.
customer_reviews.author: M A Mathews

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds my expectations!!
customer_reviews.text: This product exceeded by expectations considering its relatively modest price. It is able to accommodate everything I wanted to connect to it. I like the speaker calibration feature. I feel it eliminates the feeling that your speakers may not be performing at their optimum. The only unknown now is how long it will give trouble free performance. I heartily recommend this receiver. Jack Davis
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: The setup was not difficult and the sound and picture are a lot better than my old receiver
customer_reviews.text: I received the Onkyo TX-NR646 yesterday as a replacement for my Onkyo RC-180. The setup was not difficult and the sound and picture are a lot better than my old receiver. The Net allows for numerous choices of music from around the world and the Zone 2 works well with all my other room's stereo speakers. I downloaded the iPhone application Remote 3. It is great and allows me wireless control of the unit. In addition, has a smaller footprint in my entertainment center. I would recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: alc60

customer_reviews.title: Great but flawed product.
customer_reviews.text: I love the Onkyo A/V Receivers. I've had a number of them. They have a problem with the HDMI ports. I've had to replace each because of that.
customer_reviews.author: Vic Mclendon

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise it's pretty simple to use
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of KRK studio monitors in one room I was hoping to use the Zone 2 functionality. Turns out zone 2 only works with RCA audio inputs. It doesn't use audio from HDMI. A little disappointing. Otherwise it's pretty simple to use, especially through the iPhone app. Selecting inputs is easy, volume adjustment works great. Setup was pretty simple. The zone 2 things though.. man..
customer_reviews.author: Noe Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: this amp is awesome, it has great features and punchy sound
customer_reviews.text: this amp is awesome, it has great features and punchy sound, only wish it had outlet in the rear to power another device like older receivers had
customer_reviews.author: tim dixon

customer_reviews.title: Watch Hacksaw Ridge movie with this system and you'll be amazed by its ATMOS surround sound it produces
customer_reviews.text: WOW! If you want a "movie-house experience", this ONKYO NR-646 is what you've been waiting for. Watch Hacksaw Ridge movie with this system and you'll be amazed by its ATMOS surround sound it produces. You can hear bullets and booms zigzagging all over my room. Paired with my iphone, itunes music is superb, I used to own Denon and Yamaha, but this ONKYO system definitely is much better!
customer_reviews.author: I. M.

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.text: Junk. I'm shipping it back even if they won't take it back!
customer_reviews.author: MWN

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from a tx-nr515 and I am blown away at ...
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a tx-nr515 and I am blown away at the difference in sound quality. My theater now has true surround sound. I have to laugh often at myself for looking around the room to see what that sound was only to realize it was the surrounds.
customer_reviews.author: LSF007

customer_reviews.title: Lacking sound features
customer_reviews.text: Sounds good a little lacking in power if your a audiophile I do not recommend the built in dsp is lacking features you will find in a older surround sound receiver but for connectivity it awesome​ with hdmi WiFi music streaming & Bluetooth, it's great for movies.
customer_reviews.author: The-Installer

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement!
customer_reviews.text: A great replacement for my old ONKYO. More inputs and outputs as well as bluetooth connectivity. Got it on sale too.
customer_reviews.author: Wmo777

customer_reviews.title: Great user interface
customer_reviews.text: First Onkyo purchase. Great user interface, simple setup. Room calibration mic registered wrong speaker distance on one side & had to be manually corrected (thus 4 stars). Otherwise seems to be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jojonyc1

customer_reviews.title: Has worked great for the 3 months I've had it
customer_reviews.text: Has worked great for the 3 months I've had it. This is my 3rd Onkyo receiver and all have worked great. Only reason for replacing previous ones is because of new features available.
customer_reviews.author: R B

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: sound cuts out after changing the TV station sometimes, its annoying,. it takes a few tries switching stations to get it back, otherwise a decent product but i may return it before the warranty is up because it shouldnt be having an issue like this.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony R. Corricelli Jr.

customer_reviews.title: reliable and good for movie night
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about reliability due to some of the bad reviews but in my case this has been a very good unit for many months. great for both movies and music.
customer_reviews.author: dddfort

customer_reviews.title: I really like this receiver
customer_reviews.text: I really like this receiver. It has a lot of features found on much more expensive receivers. The only downside is that it only as one set of connectors for height (Atmos speakers).
customer_reviews.author: James A. Paige

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Works well
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Works well, love the bluetooth connectivity, and provides a good balance all around. I'm 5.1 v. 7.2, but all works well.
customer_reviews.author: Richard McDonald

customer_reviews.title: 2 hours of Awesome. Then Crickets.......
customer_reviews.text: Worked great while it was on. Unit worked 2 hours before shutting off with NG: L R code. After looking through many forums Onkyo, Reddit, Whathifi, etc... this happens a lot without many easy fixes. This unit should be on a recall list. Not sure why Onkyo has a support line they just defer to Dealer even for warranty. This will be the best money I ever got back.
customer_reviews.author: SWhite

customer_reviews.title: If you didn't know how much it cost, you might think it was much more expensive.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this receiver, but I have only used it for a few days so far. It runs much cooler than many of the previous Onkyo models. It has several features that more expensive models might have, and is still missing a few but I cannot fault it at this price point. As long as the receiver holds up, then this is a steal at this price. Bluetooth, wifi built in, great sound quality, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Eric D

customer_reviews.title: Awesome in all ways but remote
customer_reviews.text: Awesome receiver and meets all my expectations with the exception of the remote. There buttons are small, plentiful and dont light up at all so difficult to operate in the day time and even harder in low lighting.
customer_reviews.author: E. Herd

customer_reviews.title: Onkyo RAWKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed, first: "Walt's" sent me an e- explaining that Onkyo tx-nr646 7.2-channel network a/v receiver, that I originally ordered "there was glitch in the ordering system showing (10 left) when in reality there were none left, so because it was our mistake," he upgraded me to the next model (tx-nr656 7.2) to make up for the error, same price as original order! What's more, it came in half the time expected! As for the system, OMG! this thing RAWKS! I love the sound, its amazing, they just get better and better!
customer_reviews.author: P. L. Townsend

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Has performed flawlessly. Contacted support for set up issue and they were courteous and helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Morgan

customer_reviews.title: This receiver is awesome. It might take you a little while to ...
customer_reviews.text: This receiver is awesome. It might take you a little while to set up, but once you do, it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Mel R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Stereo!
customer_reviews.text: Great stereo! Couldn't find one to do any more for the price. Using it in a 5.1 setup, with 2nd room source. Also have a turntable hooked to receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Smith

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is fantastic, I was able to buy a second hand ...
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is fantastic, I was able to buy a second hand auto tuner (like 15$) for my original set up since I bought it used, works fantastically. I have it set to 6.1 with the plans to upgrade to 7.1 soon, but it still sounds amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H.

customer_reviews.title: this Onkyo was a great replacement for my Marantz that finally gave up the ...
customer_reviews.text: Although the connectivity may be a bit limited for some needs, this Onkyo was a great replacement for my Marantz that finally gave up the ghost. Getting the unit set up and dialed in took a few attempts, but it sounds amazing, whether streaming Pandora, watching Netflix, or Directv.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Great product... except that now that I'm 1 year 5 days into owning it, one of the two HDMI out ports has died... :-/
customer_reviews.author: CerbDog

customer_reviews.title: Even better than the predecessor
customer_reviews.text: Even better than the predecessor. Love how it automatically goes into standby mode and it automatically changes the volume no matter what remote is used.
customer_reviews.author: rccutler

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This receiver is amazing! I love that I can control it completely using my smartphone! And the Zone 2 setup works great for our patio and pool area!
customer_reviews.author: N. Wear

customer_reviews.title: This is my 2nd Onkyo receiver. My old unit ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Onkyo receiver. My old unit lost audio through the HDMI ports. This one has lost the ability to connect via bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: trevork

customer_reviews.title: Awesome receiver!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome receiver with a crazy amount of features. Great price for what you get with this receiver.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware... not exactly the superstar we hoped for!
customer_reviews.text: This receiver would have been perfect if it didn't constantly lose sound when switching channels. We either have to wait it out and finally get sound OR hit mute and wait, hit it again... then the sound comes in. Also, compared to our previous Denon receiver, this one has a very long delay when changing channels and starting DVR shows. We see a lot of 'black screen'. If I had to do it all over again, I would've saved my money and kept the Denon!
customer_reviews.author: FLMomOf3

product_meta.title: Onkyo TX-NR646 7.2-Channel Network A/V Receiver
product_meta.description: Experience the cutting edge of audio with the 7.2 Ch. TX-NR646 Network A/V Receiver, the first in its class to feature the revolutionary dts:X and Dolby Atmos multi-dimensional audio formats. Onkyo's high-current amplification system drives your speakers with maximum impact and fidelity at 170 watts per channel. UltraHD video capability is equally impressive, with eight HDMI 2.0a terminals including dedicated HDCP 2.2 compatible inputs for premium 4K video content and two HDMI outputs for video in separate rooms. The TX-NR646's high-grade 384kHz / 32bit AKM DAC unlocks the full potential of any audio format. Conveniently stream music over built-in Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Airplay, or Internet music services, including Spotify Connect and Pandora. Use the free Onkyo Remote app to stream audio stored on your mobile device, browse and select tracks from online services and control playback in two zones. Plus, for fans of vinyl, the TX-NR646 has a phono equalizer input to connect a turntable.
feature_bullets: DTS:X is a next-generation object-based surround sound technology that includes height to deliver a fully-immersive listening experience
Supports Dolby Atmos Up to 5.1.2 Channels for captivating, multidimensional sound

High instantaneous current enhances speaker control for accurate and dynamic audio reproduction with 170 W/Ch. (6 Ohms, 1 kHz, 0.9% THD, 1 Channel Driven, FTC) and 100 W/Ch. (8 Ohms, 20 Hz-20 kHz, 0.08% THD, 2 Channels Driven, FTC)
4K/60 Hz-Capable HDMI 2.0a Terminals for UltraHD and supports HDCP 2.2 for premium 4K/Full HD video streaming and broadcast
Built-in Bluetooth, Wi-Fi and Airplay with Pandora and Spotify to stream virtually any audio from your smartphone, tablet, or PC for clear and powerful sound

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars417 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
